meanings.definition: One who endures hardship or suffering.
meanings.sent1: The brave endurer faced the storm with courage.
meanings.sent2: The endurer showed great strength during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The little endurer teddy bear braved the pretend storm.
meanings.sent4: She was an endurer, a warrior in the battle of life.
meanings.sent5: The endurer's resilience was like a shield against adversity.

meanings.definition: To tolerate or withstand pain or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: He had to endurer the pain of his injury without complaint.
meanings.sent2: She could endurer the long journey without rest.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to endurer wearing a tiny hat for fun.
meanings.sent4: Endurering the challenge, she emerged stronger than before.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to endurer the grueling race to reach the finish line.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or last.
meanings.sent1: The old building has managed to endurer for centuries.
meanings.sent2: The tradition will endurer through generations to come.
meanings.sent3: The cake tried to endurer on the table, but it was too tempting.
meanings.sent4: Their love seemed to endurer all obstacles in its path.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood endurer in the heart forever.
